metadata.titel_preek: The God Who Calls, the Child Who Responds

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God establishes a relationship with His people by calling individuals by name and creating the conditions for their obedience, specifically through the transition from the corrupt house of Eli to the prophetic ministry of Samuel.

tekstueel_bewijs: The Lord called Samuel again the third time
The Word of God raises up a person and creates the conditions for him to obey
God was favoring Samuel before Samuel even knew who God was

object.identificatie: The knowledge of God / The Word of God revealed to the person
tekstueel_bewijs: Samuel did not yet know the Lord, and the Word of God had not yet been revealed to him
His knowledge of God... her legacy to us

zender.identificatie: God (as the source of the Word)
tekstueel_bewijs: The word of the Lord was rare in those days
It is the Lord speaking, not Samuel’s religious imagination
The story of Samuel is the story of Israel, and the story of Israel is your story
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of the call.

tekstueel_bewijs: Eli turns out to be a good surrogate father
Eli perceived that the Lord was calling the boy
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who uses Eli as a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the Word and the 'lamp of God'.

tegenstander.identificatie: The 'Worthless Men' (Sons of Eli) and the state of 'No Regard for the Lord'
tekstueel_bewijs: The sons of Eli were worthless men; they had no regard for the Lord
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The lack of regard for the Lord is defined as the 'foundational offense' that threatens the very existence of the sanctuary and the people's future.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical mandate for parents/grandparents to teach children the Bible stories so they recognize God's voice.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer (Parents/Grandparents)
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program is presented as a response to the primary fact that God is a God who calls.

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord came and stood forth
God picks them out before they are born
voorbeelden_mens_subject: Samuel arose and went to Eli

voorbeelden: May we each re-dedicate ourselves to do our part
Samuel did not yet know the Lord
Eli perceived that the Lord was calling
The Word of God... creates the conditions for him to obey
Trust him to do with us and for us that which we cannot do for ourselves

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes that the ability to hear and respond is a gift (Pouvoir) created by the Word itself, rather than a natural human capacity (Savoir) or a mere obligation (Devoir).

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From the silence of S1 (rare word) through the depravity of S2 (sons of Eli), to the restoration of S1 through the call of Samuel.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by God 'standing forth'—the Word breaks the silence and overcomes the depravity.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the corruption of the sanctuary and the doom of Eli's house are treated as real and devastating.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. It explicitly rejects the idea that Samuel's call is a product of his imagination and insists that God creates the conditions for obedience.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: May we each re-dedicate ourselves to do our part

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the initiator of the call
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The Word of God raises up a person and creates the conditions for him to obey.
Trust him to do with us and for us that which we cannot do for ourselves.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: While Samuel and Eli are models, they are models of 'receiving' and 'recognizing' God's action rather than models of moral performance.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides the theocentric reading: God calls despite the failure of the human actors.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and assurance that God's call is not dependent on their own 'religious imagination'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic call; God's word is performative.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the biblical narrative to the personal application is seamless, maintaining God as the primary Subject throughout.
spanning_punten: The shift to 'our part' with children at the end slightly shifts the Subject to the hearer, but it is framed as a response to God's prior call.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: The story of Samuel is the story of Israel, and the story of Israel is your story.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'worthless' and 'corrupt to the core'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative program. The 'engine' of the sermon is the performative power of the Word.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Savoir (knowing the stories) at the end.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Emphasize that even when we fail to teach perfectly, the Word still has the power to find the child.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in maintaining the 'Grammar of Grace' while addressing the human experience of parenting and legacy.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of childhood nostalgia, Greimas reveals that the nostalgia is subordinate to the actant of the 'Calling God'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical Shiloh; semiotics shows how the 'Rare Word' functions as a lack that only the Subject (God) can fill.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas exposes that the 'Helper' (Eli) is only effective when he points the 'Receiver' (Samuel) back to the 'Sender' (God).

appendices.notities: The sermon avoids the 'Be like Samuel' trap by focusing on 'The God who calls Samuel'.
